snippet: Homeowners who refinance into conventional loans may need to write sizable checks at the closing, but they are likely to reduce their monthly payments while improving their cash flow.
abstract: Vickie Elmer Mortgages column on homeowners who are abandoning jumbo mortgages in favor of conventional loans; holds that decision may mean writing sizable checks at closing, but is likely to reduce monthly payments while improving cash flow: graph of mortgage rates in the New York region.
lead_paragraph: Homeowners who refinance into conventional loans may need to write sizable checks at the closing, but they are likely to reduce their monthly payments while improving their cash flow.
